update.description: Since Reset World appeared to fix the pose offset, I've set the collisions to reset at the end of Init. It appears to fix issue #264 for me without breaking drc_sim_v0.

content.raw: I tested this, and it looks cleaner to me than what I currently have in this branch. I've committed John's patch to [branch issue_264_alt](#!/osrf/gazebo/compare/issue_264_alt..default) and it appears to work for me. I can switch this pull request to that other branch if Nate approves.
content.html: I tested this, and it looks cleaner to me than what I currently have in this branch. I've committed John's patch to branch issue_264_alt and it appears to work for me. I can switch this pull request to that other branch if Nate approves.

pull_request.title: Fix for issue #264, incorrect initial placement of collision with relative pose

pullrequest.title: Fix for issue #264, incorrect initial placement of collision with relative pose

content.html:
It was the initialization order in Collision::Init(), not doing shape->Init() first does not recurse into ODECollision::OnPoseChange() as Link::Init() calls children Collision::Init() which calls Entity::SetWorldPoseDefault which calls Entity::UpdatePhysicsPose which calls this->OnPoseChange that trickles down to ODECollision::OnPoseChange if it was initialized.

$ hg diff
diff -r c8974309a98d gazebo/physics/Collision.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/Collision.cc   Thu Dec 06 08:02:49 2012 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/physics/Collision.cc   Thu Dec 06 18:58:53 2012 -0800
@@ -109,10 +109,10 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void Collision::Init()
 {
+  this->shape->Init();
+
   this->SetRelativePose(
     this->sdf->GetValuePose("pose"));
-
-  this->shape->Init();
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
diff -r c8974309a98d gazebo/physics/Link.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/Link.cc    Thu Dec 06 08:02:49 2012 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/physics/Link.cc    Thu Dec 06 18:58:53 2012 -0800
@@ -157,14 +157,9 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void Link::Init()
 {
-  Base_V::iterator iter;
-  for (iter = this->children.begin(); iter != this->children.end(); ++iter)
-  {
-    if ((*iter)->HasType(Base::COLLISION))
-      boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->Init();
-  }
+  this->SetKinematic(this->sdf->GetValueBool("kinematic"));

-  this->SetKinematic(this->sdf->GetValueBool("kinematic"));
+  this->SetGravityMode(this->sdf->GetValueBool("gravity"));

   this->SetLinearDamping(this->GetLinearDamping());
   this->SetAngularDamping(this->GetAngularDamping());
@@ -231,6 +226,13 @@
   // DO THIS LAST!
   this->SetRelativePose(this->sdf->GetValuePose("pose"));
   this->SetInitialRelativePose(this->sdf->GetValuePose("pose"));
+
+  Base_V::iterator iter;
+  for (iter = this->children.begin(); iter != this->children.end(); ++iter)
+  {
+    if ((*iter)->HasType(Base::COLLISION))
+      boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->Init();
+  }
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////

pull_request.title: Fix for issue #264, incorrect initial placement of collision with relative pose

pullrequest.title: Fix for issue #264, incorrect initial placement of collision with relative pose

content.html:
Seems to me the problem might be Collision::Init() is not called at the right time, it should come after the parent had a chance to call Init() on itself first. How about below?

Also, I noticed that SetGravityMode was removed by accident in one of the merges, so I recovered it below as well:

$ hg diff
diff -r c8974309a98d gazebo/physics/Link.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/Link.cc    Thu Dec 06 08:02:49 2012 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/physics/Link.cc    Thu Dec 06 08:52:52 2012 -0800
@@ -157,14 +157,9 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void Link::Init()
 {
-  Base_V::iterator iter;
-  for (iter = this->children.begin(); iter != this->children.end(); ++iter)
-  {
-    if ((*iter)->HasType(Base::COLLISION))
-      boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->Init();
-  }
+  this->SetKinematic(this->sdf->GetValueBool("kinematic"));

-  this->SetKinematic(this->sdf->GetValueBool("kinematic"));
+  this->SetGravityMode(this->sdf->GetValueBool("gravity"));

   this->SetLinearDamping(this->GetLinearDamping());
   this->SetAngularDamping(this->GetAngularDamping());
@@ -231,6 +226,13 @@
   // DO THIS LAST!
   this->SetRelativePose(this->sdf->GetValuePose("pose"));
   this->SetInitialRelativePose(this->sdf->GetValuePose("pose"));
+
+  Base_V::iterator iter;
+  for (iter = this->children.begin(); iter != this->children.end(); ++iter)
+  {
+    if ((*iter)->HasType(Base::COLLISION))
+      boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->Init();
+  }
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////

pull_request.title: Fix for issue #264, incorrect initial placement of collision with relative pose

pullrequest.title: Fix for issue #264, incorrect initial placement of collision with relative pose

content.raw:
Try changing this line to:
`boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->SetRelativePose(boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->initialRelativePose);` 

You'll have to make `Entity::initialRelativePose` public for testing. If that works, add an accessor for `initialRelativePose`.

Also a comment to this loop about why it exists.
content.html:
Try changing this line to: boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->SetRelativePose(boost::shared_static_cast<Collision>(*iter)->initialRelativePose);

You'll have to make Entity::initialRelativePose public for testing. If that works, add an accessor for initialRelativePose.

Also a comment to this loop about why it exists.
